meanings.definition: Making a rustling or whistling sound.
meanings.sent1: The wind blew through the trees, making them sound swishier.
meanings.sent2: Her new dress was swishier than her old one.
meanings.sent3: The leaves danced in the wind, sounding even swishier than before.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed swiftly, creating a swishier sound as it rushed by.
meanings.sent5: The curtains moved gently, producing a swishier noise with each sway.

meanings.sent1: She felt confident in her swishier outfit.
meanings.sent2: The new boutique in town had swishier clothes than the old store.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at a new hairstyle ended up looking even swishier than expected.
meanings.sent4: The city lights at night made the skyline appear swishier than during the day.
meanings.sent5: The fashion show featured models in the swishier designs of the season.
